channel.title: [Sug]Way to reduce the Moparscape questions
channel.description:
Ok, first of all, we all know that the constant MoparScape questions is an issue that has gone on long enough. It should be put to an end, or reduced. I propose we make a few edits to the TOS Page, add a new Search engine page, and add Verification for members.
[ul][li]1. Instead of having the "Yes" input box, we make it so the user has to quote a section of the rules, most likely being the MoparScape question rule, or even making it random. [/li] [li]2. Adding a search engine, the search engine would be placed right after the TOS, and on the page there would be two buttons, a "Go to Moparisthebest" and a "Get MoparScape Help" button. By clicking the go to Moparisthebest, it would redirect you obviously, and the other would redirect you to a search engine, and possibly a list of Q&A's below it.[/li] [li]3. For the Verification, you would take a new quiz on the forums. Passing the quiz would store the data, and you wouldn't have to view the TOS Page. Or, you would only have to type, "Yes" and hit "I agree". You could leave out the new quiz part, but I think there should be some way of doing it so the people who should be verified will be verified. and it will be as swift as possible. [/li][/ul]
This may all seem a little extreme just for 2 or 3 posts a day, but it isn't just addressing that issue, it's getting help to the people that need it, by having a search engine, new users can get the answers they need right away. By Modifying the TOS, it makes users read the rules carefully, so they can become better members of the community, productive ones at that.
I hope everyone takes some of my ideas to mind, I'm just looking out for the best interests of everyone.
~ThAt0n36Uy
Pictures:
-Search Engine page suggestion [center][IMG]http://img452.imageshack.us/img452/866/searchengineoz4.png[/img][/center]
Links: (Visit the first page and try it out, It doesn't fully work because I only did a short JavaScript form, instead of PHP)
-[URL=http://www.clansierra.info/tos/tos.html]Tos Page[/URL]
-[URL=http://www.clansierra.info/tos/tos2.htm]Tos page 2[/URL]
-[URL=http://www.clansierra.info/tos/help.htm]Help Page[/URL]

item.title: [Sug]Way to reduce the Moparscape questions
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“ThugLife, post:31, topic:109544”][quote author=ThugLife link=topic=198515.msg1773690#msg1773690 date=1190503291]
There is hardly any problem with moparscapers posting here, seriously i don’t even see 1 post a day regularly, even still 1 post a day is hardly a problem.

Even still all this ‘delete moparscape’ shit needs to stop, yes even though i do not like it, and all the children and pointless screaming and crap that goes on there is the reason i did not stay ‘messing’ with private servers for more than a month, yes i still hung around there and still do post there every once to see if they have progressed much, and everyone needs a good laugh once and a while

So cut the ‘delete moparscape’ shit because it is causing you next to no problem if you just ignore it, its not like you get 50 posts a day asking about private servers on this site, you get an odd one or two, not even that.

no, i mean come up with a completely differnet password. not one that everyone would know.

Defeats the whole purpose of the community, this is supposed to be a ‘open’ and ‘free’ community, the whole password protected idea is stupid in my opinion.
[/quote][/quote]

What does that mean? What gravity does that have on the whole subject? This isn’t just about keeping MoparScape questions off of Moparisthebest, it’s a way of getting help to the MoparScapers. Having a help website with easy access to MoparScape information, it’s the best way to help.

Read full topic

So cut the ‘delete moparscape’ shit because it is causing you next to no problem if you just ignore it, its not like you get 50 posts a day asking about private servers on this site, you get an odd one or two, not even that.

no, i mean come up with a completely differnet password. not one that everyone would know.
